headshotImage.longCaption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla b Southee 119 (135b 15x4 0x6 185m) SR: 88.14

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Amla moved outside leg too early, giving Southee a full view of the stumps. Amla then tried to steer the ball to third man but Southee shortened his length to beat the bat and hit the stumps. He goes after a superb innings

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c Ronchi b Neesham 67 (73b 3x4 2x6 81m) SR: 91.78

dismissalComment.html: caught behind! A sharp one from Neesham! It pitched on a good length just outside off and bounced more than Faf expected. He stayed in his crease and tried to run it down to third man but the bounce made the ball graze the edge for a comfortable catch to the wicketkeeper Ronchi

bowled off the inside edge! The ball was full outside off and de Kock was not forward as he played a hard swatty-slog. Not too sure where he was trying to hit the ball. It looked like a golf swing that he stopped mid-way. McClenaghan celebrates after he sees the ball ricochet on to the stumps. The umpires check the front-foot no-ball; McClenaghan was just safe

another wicket falls, McClenaghan gets his 50th ODI wicket. He bangs the ball in short and rushes Philander on the pull. The batsman mis-times the shot and holes out to Brownlie ho comes running in from the miwicket boundary to take the catch. McClenaghan is joint second on the list of bowlers quickest to 50 ODI wickets.

he's gone this time! AB was looking to smash the ball for a six over the leg side but got a top edge that went straight up in the air and fell into Ronchi's gloves. Tremendous breakthrough for Southee and New Zealand. That skier was swirling so Ronchi did well to judge it.

bowled him! Amla moved outside leg too early, giving Southee a full view of the stumps. Amla then tried to steer the ball to third man but Southee shortened his length to beat the bat and hit the stumps. He goes after a superb innings

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock b McClenaghan 26 (33b 3x4 0x6 54m) SR: 78.78

dismissalComment.html: bowled off the inside edge! The ball was full outside off and de Kock was not forward as he played a hard swatty-slog. Not too sure where he was trying to hit the ball. It looked like a golf swing that he stopped mid-way. McClenaghan celebrates after he sees the ball ricochet on to the stumps. The umpires check the front-foot no-ball; McClenaghan was just safe

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c Ronchi b Neesham 67 (73b 3x4 2x6 81m) SR: 91.78

dismissalComment.html: caught behind! A sharp one from Neesham! It pitched on a good length just outside off and bounced more than Faf expected. He stayed in his crease and tried to run it down to third man but the bounce made the ball graze the edge for a comfortable catch to the wicketkeeper Ronchi

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c Ronchi b Southee 37 (25b 5x4 1x6 42m) SR: 148

dismissalComment.html: he's gone this time! AB was looking to smash the ball for a six over the leg side but got a top edge that went straight up in the air and fell into Ronchi's gloves. Tremendous breakthrough for Southee and New Zealand. That skier was swirling so Ronchi did well to judge it.

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla b Southee 119 (135b 15x4 0x6 185m) SR: 88.14

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Amla moved outside leg too early, giving Southee a full view of the stumps. Amla then tried to steer the ball to third man but Southee shortened his length to beat the bat and hit the stumps. He goes after a superb innings

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy lbw b Boult 19 (16b 2x4 0x6 28m) SR: 118.75

dismissalComment.html: lbw! That looked like a slower ball out of the back of the hand and after the umpire raises his finger quickly, Duminy asks for a review. He had moved a long way across his stumps to turn the ball off his pads and was hit in front of middle. There was no bat on it and the ball hit just above the knee roll. So that looks pretty good for New Zealand. Replays indicate that it's an umpire's call on height so Duminy's on his way

dismissalText.commentary: Rilee Rossouw c Guptill b Boult 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: he's gone first ball! Rossouw tries to drive in sixth gear from the start, slogging across the line. He drags a good length slower ball from outside off stump and hits it straight to Guptill on the deep midwicket boundary.

headshotImage.caption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Vernon Philander c Brownlie b McClenaghan 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: another wicket falls, McClenaghan gets his 50th ODI wicket. He bangs the ball in short and rushes Philander on the pull. The batsman mis-times the shot and holes out to Brownlie ho comes running in from the miwicket boundary to take the catch. McClenaghan is joint second on the list of bowlers quickest to 50 ODI wickets.

dismissalText.commentary: Dale Steyn c Ronchi b Anderson 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Steyn's gone as well. What a limp finish from South Africa. He stepped out and slogged, was cramped for room and got a top edge that went straight up in the air. Ronchi ran in to take the catch near the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller b Anderson 7 (10b 0x4 0x6 29m) SR: 70

dismissalComment.html: Miller's gone now. He hasn't been able to get going at all. Anderson bowls on a good length and straight, Miller clears his front foot and slogs across the line, gets an inside edge on to his stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Ronchi c du Plessis b Philander 79 (83b 7x4 1x6 120m) SR: 95.18

dismissalComment.html: it's all over! South Africa have been kept in the field for much longer than they would have liked, but in the end it is a thumping victory for them. Ronchi will have to wait for his maiden hundred. He falls after slicing the ball over point but Faf was quick enough to run back and take a well-judged catch

dismissalText.commentary: Mitchell McClenaghan not out 34 (43b 4x4 0x6 63m) SR: 79.06

dismissalComment.html: Guptill played 11 dots in a row and has now hit a half-volley straight to cover. Such a soft dismissal. When in form he might have hammered that through the infield. The ball was there to be hit and Guptill just fluffed it, there was room too. The umpires check if Philander's front foot is okay, it is, but a small margin.

it's all over! South Africa have been kept in the field for much longer than they would have liked, but in the end it is a thumping victory for them. Ronchi will have to wait for his maiden hundred. He falls after slicing the ball over point but Faf was quick enough to run back and take a well-judged catch

headshotImage.caption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: New Zealand are in tatters. Steyn pitched on a good length around middle and off and the ball went straight through to hit the top of off stump. It did not deviate or anything. Brownlie simply drove down the wrong line with no footwork at all

Anderson takes a moment to register what has happened, and then it sinks in that he has been caught superbly at short midwicket by David Miller. Steyn banged in a short ball, it did not get that high and so Anderson pulled, and pulled hard. He made good contact and the ball flew so rapidly to Miller, who was rock steady at short midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Martin Guptill c Rossouw b Philander 11 (29b 1x4 0x6 31m) SR: 37.93

dismissalComment.html: Guptill played 11 dots in a row and has now hit a half-volley straight to cover. Such a soft dismissal. When in form he might have hammered that through the infield. The ball was there to be hit and Guptill just fluffed it, there was room too. The umpires check if Philander's front foot is okay, it is, but a small margin.

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: James Neesham b Morkel 10 (18b 1x4 0x6 36m) SR: 55.55

dismissalComment.html: oh Matthew, what a jinx! That ball was too full to stay back to. Neesham did not move his feet and was stuck in his crease as he tried to drive away from his body and hit the ball through cover. It ricocheted on to the stumps off the inside edge

dismissalText.commentary: Tom Latham c Amla b de Villiers 16 (28b 2x4 0x6 33m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: AB's got a wicket off a long hop! That's his maiden ODI wicket. That was so short and Latham should have smashed that for six. Instead he played a little, delicate paddle-pull and hit it straight to short fine leg. This is just weak from New Zealand. They have hardly shown any intent against a part-time part-timer.

headshotImage.caption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dean Brownlie b Steyn 20 (28b 3x4 0x6 45m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: New Zealand are in tatters. Steyn pitched on a good length around middle and off and the ball went straight through to hit the top of off stump. It did not deviate or anything. Brownlie simply drove down the wrong line with no footwork at all

dismissalText.commentary: Corey Anderson c Miller b Steyn 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: Anderson takes a moment to register what has happened, and then it sinks in that he has been caught superbly at short midwicket by David Miller. Steyn banged in a short ball, it did not get that high and so Anderson pulled, and pulled hard. He made good contact and the ball flew so rapidly to Miller, who was rock steady at short midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Brendon McCullum lbw b Imran Tahir 12 (25b 0x4 0x6 39m) SR: 48

dismissalComment.html: another sweep from McCullum, another tremendously excitable appeal from Tahir, once again umpire Davis raises the finger, and once again McCullum reviews. He had lunged a long way forward to sweep and missed. This time he was hit in line with the stumps very low on the front pad by the googly. Was there a bottom edge? Hot Spot doesn't seem to indicate one. The angle is tight. Snicko says no edge too. So if this is going on to hit the stumps, McCullum will have to go. Replays say it's going to hit middle and leg. Gone.

dismissalText.commentary: Daniel Vettori b Duminy 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: another batsman goes while trying to sweep. Bowled this time. It was a flighted delivery in line with the stumps and it dipped under Vettori's bat as he swiped across the line

dismissalText.commentary: Tim Southee b Imran Tahir 5 (5b 1x4 0x6 6m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: bowled by the googly! Southee did not pick it. He stayed back in his crease as the ball pitched outside off and spun back in to hit off and middle stump. Southee just played a half-cut at the delivery, but to be fair it kept a bit low

dismissalText.commentary: Trent Boult b de Villiers 10 (13b 2x4 0x6 19m) SR: 76.92

dismissalComment.html: AB has a second wicket! He followed Boult with a slower ball after the batsman made room outside leg stump to hammer the ball across the line. Boult missed and the ball hit the pads outside the line of leg stump and then ricocheted on to the stumps. That kept very low. AB is absolutely beaming

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Ronchi c du Plessis b Philander 79 (83b 7x4 1x6 120m) SR: 95.18

dismissalComment.html: it's all over! South Africa have been kept in the field for much longer than they would have liked, but in the end it is a thumping victory for them. Ronchi will have to wait for his maiden hundred. He falls after slicing the ball over point but Faf was quick enough to run back and take a well-judged catch

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Ronchi c du Plessis b Philander 79 (83b 7x4 1x6 120m) SR: 95.18

commentTextItems.html: it's all over! South Africa have been kept in the field for much longer than they would have liked, but in the end it is a thumping victory for them. Ronchi will have to wait for his maiden hundred. He falls after slicing the ball over point but Faf was quick enough to run back and take a well-judged catch

commentPostTextItems.html: 6.15 pm South Africa have won the series with a 2-0 lead after another no-show from New Zealand's top-order batsmen. Their bowlers did a decent job of reining in South Africa but all of it was in vain. Only Luke Ronchi showed spine in the chase.
Sameer: "SAF is Hiring, wanted a bowler who can take the 10th wicket in a match"
Dan: "More than twice the next best partnership. The other nine players really need to ask themselves some questions."
Alex: "Wow, the guy who mailed in pre-match and said he'd taken SA by 70 runs in an office sweepstake really knows his stuff." Michael, it was.

Brendon McCullum: "Wasn't great, batting let us down, bowling was okay. We were good in the field. Too many soft dismissals, little backbone at the end but far too little too late. We got to continue to get used to the conditions, short on adapting to this wicket ... we got a bit of hard work to do over the next two days. 280 at the half-way mark was okay, the bowlers kept coming back nicely in those last ten overs. It's a beautiful ground and a fantastic place, great crowd as well."

AB de Villiers: "It was a bit frustrating at the end, we lost Immi so I had to make up the overs too. I;ve been bowling a little bit, discussing the options, if I can land it it will be handy in certain games, I won't bowl in all the games. When Hashim bats like that it just sets up the whole line up to be aggressive ... another great hundred ... I thought Quinny started well as well, always important to get a good opening stand. We have about eight games down under and we want to win most of them."

Hashim Amla is the Man of the Match: "It felt good, it was difficult early on. The little things went out way and we managed to hang in there quite a while. Today the wicket was doing a bit and the guys were bowlign well so it did not allow us to go hard up front but we were able to push on in the middle ..."
That's all I've got for you at the moment. Thank you for all your emails today. Join us on October 27 for the final game. Cheers!

commentTextItems.html: mis-timed towards mid-on for a single, McClenaghan ran the first hard wanting the second, but decided against it
McClenaghan backs away and slogs at a short of a length ball outside off, he makes no contact

commentPostTextItems.html: Philander's back to try and end this ...

commentTextItems.html: McClenaghan clears his front foot and slogs a short of a length ball to wide long on, New Zealand have broken their record last wicket stand in ODIs two games in a row. Move over Trent Boult, McClenaghan has taken your spot with Ronchi.
Ronchi does it much more conventionally, steering the ball with an open face to third man
McClenaghan jumps outside the line of off stump and tries to glance Steyn past the keeper, gets hit on the pad and runs a leg bye to fine leg
plays a lofted cover drive into the deep, falls short of the fielder
so much for mundanity! Ronchi swivels and pulls a short ball, hitting it over the infield and into the gap on the midwicket boundary

commentPreTextItems.html: RobbieMc: "We should just pick ten bowlers and Ronchi. It would give us more bowling options while sacrificing nothing with the bat. "

commentTextItems.html: full and straight, Ronchi plays it watchfully back to the bowler, all rather mundane after McClenaghan's bravado

commentPreTextItems.html: gav: "Why couldn't Chris Martin ever do this"

commentTextItems.html: McClenaghan feels he can do anything now! He jumps outside the line of off stump and then tries to scoop a short of a length ball over de Kock, he does not make any contact
Morkel is taking a beating from a No. 11, McClenaghan makes room by moving outside leg and then swings freely, smashing the ball past mid-on
dug in short again, just outside leg, McClenaghan moves towards the off side to let it pass, should have been called wide even though the batsman moved a long way
Morkel digs it in shorter and McClenaghan moves out of the way after initially shaping to swipe at it
what a shot that is! McClenaghan has just lined up a length ball and slammed it back over the bowler's head, clean contact that time

commentPreTextItems.html: Mani: "SA's top order and NZ bottom 5 will make a world class team."

commentTextItems.html: McClenaghan clears his front foot and slogs at a length ball that's pretty straight, he gets an inside edge that misses the stumps and races to the fine leg boundary
worked off the pads to short fine leg for a single
defended back to the bowler
superb from McClenaghan, slog sweeps and executes it superbly, hitting the ball in front of the fielder on the deep backward square leg boundary

commentPreTextItems.html: Michael: "Ronchi has now outscored the NZ top 6 combined. Again."

commentTextItems.html: defended on the front foot on the leg side
cut off the back foot and it beats the fielder at point, another fielder chases and pulls it in just inside the rope, Faf gave chase. That brings up the 50 partnership!

commentPostTextItems.html: Charlie: "These two really need to pick up the pace a little bit, I don't think they can leave it all till the last five overs today."

The batsman mis-times the shot and holes out to Brownlie ho comes running in from the miwicket boundary to take the catch. McClenaghan is joint second on the list of bowlers quickest to 50 ODI wickets.

dismissalText.commentary: Dale Steyn c Ronchi b Anderson 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Steyn's gone as well. What a limp finish from South Africa. He stepped out and slogged, was cramped for room and got a top edge that went straight up in the air. Ronchi ran in to take the catch near the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller b Anderson 7 (10b 0x4 0x6 29m) SR: 70

dismissalComment.html: Miller's gone now. He hasn't been able to get going at all. Anderson bowls on a good length and straight, Miller clears his front foot and slogs across the line, gets an inside edge on to his stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Martin Guptill c Rossouw b Philander 11 (29b 1x4 0x6 31m) SR: 37.93

dismissalComment.html: Guptill played 11 dots in a row and has now hit a half-volley straight to cover. Such a soft dismissal. When in form he might have hammered that through the infield. The ball was there to be hit and Guptill just fluffed it, there was room too. The umpires check if Philander's front foot is okay, it is, but a small margin.

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: James Neesham b Morkel 10 (18b 1x4 0x6 36m) SR: 55.55

dismissalComment.html: oh Matthew, what a jinx! That ball was too full to stay back to. Neesham did not move his feet and was stuck in his crease as he tried to drive away from his body and hit the ball through cover. It ricocheted on to the stumps off the inside edge

headshotImage.caption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dean Brownlie b Steyn 20 (28b 3x4 0x6 45m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: New Zealand are in tatters. Steyn pitched on a good length around middle and off and the ball went straight through to hit the top of off stump. It did not deviate or anything. Brownlie simply drove down the wrong line with no footwork at all

dismissalText.commentary: Tom Latham c Amla b de Villiers 16 (28b 2x4 0x6 33m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: AB's got a wicket off a long hop! That's his maiden ODI wicket. That was so short and Latham should have smashed that for six. Instead he played a little, delicate paddle-pull and hit it straight to short fine leg. This is just weak from New Zealand. They have hardly shown any intent against a part-time part-timer.

dismissalText.commentary: Brendon McCullum lbw b Imran Tahir 12 (25b 0x4 0x6 39m) SR: 48

dismissalComment.html: another sweep from McCullum, another tremendously excitable appeal from Tahir, once again umpire Davis raises the finger, and once again McCullum reviews. He had lunged a long way forward to sweep and missed. This time he was hit in line with the stumps very low on the front pad by the googly. Was there a bottom edge? Hot Spot doesn't seem to indicate one. The angle is tight. Snicko says no edge too. So if this is going on to hit the stumps, McCullum will have to go. Replays say it's going to hit middle and leg. Gone.

dismissalText.commentary: Corey Anderson c Miller b Steyn 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: Anderson takes a moment to register what has happened, and then it sinks in that he has been caught superbly at short midwicket by David Miller. Steyn banged in a short ball, it did not get that high and so Anderson pulled, and pulled hard. He made good contact and the ball flew so rapidly to Miller, who was rock steady at short midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Ronchi c du Plessis b Philander 79 (83b 7x4 1x6 120m) SR: 95.18

dismissalComment.html: it's all over! South Africa have been kept in the field for much longer than they would have liked, but in the end it is a thumping victory for them. Ronchi will have to wait for his maiden hundred. He falls after slicing the ball over point but Faf was quick enough to run back and take a well-judged catch

dismissalText.commentary: Daniel Vettori b Duminy 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: another batsman goes while trying to sweep. Bowled this time. It was a flighted delivery in line with the stumps and it dipped under Vettori's bat as he swiped across the line

dismissalText.commentary: Tim Southee b Imran Tahir 5 (5b 1x4 0x6 6m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: bowled by the googly! Southee did not pick it. He stayed back in his crease as the ball pitched outside off and spun back in to hit off and middle stump. Southee just played a half-cut at the delivery, but to be fair it kept a bit low

dismissalText.commentary: Trent Boult b de Villiers 10 (13b 2x4 0x6 19m) SR: 76.92

dismissalComment.html: AB has a second wicket! He followed Boult with a slower ball after the batsman made room outside leg stump to hammer the ball across the line. Boult missed and the ball hit the pads outside the line of leg stump and then ricocheted on to the stumps. That kept very low. AB is absolutely beaming

dismissalText.commentary: Mitchell McClenaghan not out 34 (43b 4x4 0x6 63m) SR: 79.06

headshotImage.caption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021

notes: South Africa innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 41 runs, 0 wicket)
South Africa: 50 runs in 11.2 overs (68 balls), Extras 2
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 68 balls (HM Amla 25, Q de Kock 24, Ex 2)
Drinks: South Africa - 81/1 in 16.0 overs (HM Amla 40, F du Plessis 11)
South Africa: 100 runs in 19.3 overs (118 balls), Extras 4
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 46 balls (HM Amla 21, F du Plessis 28, Ex 1)
HM Amla: 50 off 69 balls (7 x 4)
F du Plessis: 50 off 52 balls (3 x 4, 1 x 6)
South Africa: 150 runs in 29.3 overs (179 balls), Extras 5
2nd Wicket: 100 runs in 106 balls (HM Amla 37, F du Plessis 61, Ex 2)
Drinks: South Africa - 169/2 in 33.1 overs (HM Amla 71)
Powerplay 2: Overs 33.1 - 38.0 (Batting side - 40 runs, 1 wicket)
South Africa: 200 runs in 37.1 overs (225 balls), Extras 5
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 41 balls (HM Amla 23, AB de Villiers 27, Ex 0)
Over 40.5: Review by New Zealand (Bowling), Umpire - SJ Davis, Batsman - AB de Villiers (Struck down)
HM Amla: 100 off 127 balls (11 x 4)
South Africa: 250 runs in 43.3 overs (263 balls), Extras 6
Over 47.5: Review by South Africa (Batting), Umpire - DJ Walker, Batsman - JP Duminy (Struck down)
Innings Break: South Africa - 282/9 in 50.0 overs (M Morkel 0, Imran Tahir 0)
New Zealand innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 33 runs, 2 wickets)
New Zealand: 50 runs in 13.3 overs (81 balls), Extras 6
Over 20.2: Review by New Zealand (Batting), Umpire - SJ Davis, Batsman - BB McCullum (Upheld)
Over 24.1: Review by New Zealand (Batting), Umpire - SJ Davis, Batsman - BB McCullum (Struck down)
New Zealand: 100 runs in 27.2 overs (165 balls), Extras 7
Drinks: New Zealand - 134/9 in 33.0 overs (L Ronchi 39)
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 23 runs, 0 wicket)
L Ronchi: 50 off 57 balls (4 x 4, 1 x 6)
New Zealand: 150 runs in 37.2 overs (225 balls), Extras 9
Over 42.4: Review by South Africa (Bowling), Umpire - SJ Davis, Batsman - MJ McClenaghan (Struck down)
10th Wicket: 50 runs in 62 balls (L Ronchi 34, MJ McClenaghan 15, Ex 1)
New Zealand: 200 runs in 44.5 overs (270 balls), Extras 10

milestones.description: Luke Ronchi and McClenaghan's 76-run partnership is NZ's highest for the 10th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 74 between Luke Ronchi and Trent Boult

stories.title: South Africa take series with Amla century

stories.summary: Hashim Amla's 16th ODI century served as the fulcrum to another resolute South African batting performance that set up a series win over New Zealand

stories.title: De Kock going to be a superstar for us - Amla
stories.subTitle: NZ v SA, 2nd ODI, Mount Maunganui
stories.seoTitle: De Kock going to be a superstar for us - Amla
stories.summary: Quinton de Kock has had four low scores but his opening partner Hashim Amla said there was no need for concern and that it was a natural part of a youngster growing up

image.caption: Quinton de Kock and Hashim Amla added 118 for the first wicket
